data.text: @RichardHills_ @rangir53 @DrJinRussell Get this out to those moron "protesters".

@RichardHills_ @DrJinRussell They never told us to isolate or anything.  Admitted both of us to paediatric ward as I had to stay with him.  I never got a Covid swab done.  And I still don’t have the results of his swab back.  Googled when we got home “can Covid cause croup?”  Answer yes.

@RichardHills_ @DrJinRussell Thank you.  Now time to educate hospital staff.  My toddler had croup before Christmas.  They put us in the fun zone (red zone) at ED for potential Covid.  Apologetically they did a Covid swab while saying this is just [our dumb protocol] (paraphrasing)he has croup and not Covid.
@RichardHills_ @DrJinRussell Has anyone seen something like this in New Zealand? I bought them in Singapore. We found them really good when the kids had a fever! https://t.co/RfNxrFe7Xi
@DrJinRussell @RichardHills_ Also thanks for asking the question and then sharing @RichardHills_
@DrJinRussell @RichardHills_ Thanks @DrJinRussell. Super helpful info as always

@RichardHills_ @DrJinRussell Lots of skin to skin as well. Practice safe sleeping habits if they only sleep on you when ill.  Babywearing in a close, well fitted sling can be helpful when going out and about so that people don't get too close to them (to prevent the baby catching it).
